Description: Rim and body sherd with handle root (mended from four fragments, including 1888,0601.246, and added plaster) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, dilute lines between black lines; wall glazed; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with line between, glazed below with reserved band on lower wall; glazed black on handle root; inscription on interior of lip.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.246.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 270)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.695) (Phase 3)
